casebody.data:
J. A. WIGGINS and Dovie B. Wiggins, Piaintiffs-Appellants, v. ENGELHARD MINERALS & CHEMICAL CORPORATION, Defendant-Appellee. No. 30143. United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. June 9, 1971. R. Lamar Brannon, G. Dean Booth, Jr., Atlanta, Ga., Dorothy W. Russell, Decatur, Ga., Troutman, Sams, Schroder & Lockerman, Atlanta, Ga., for appellants. Irwin L. Evans, Sandersville, Ga., Frank C. Jones, Timothy K. Adams, Macon, Ga., Jones, Cork, Miller & Benton, Macon, Ga., of counsel, for appellee.

Before THORNBERRY, GODBOLD and MORGAN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

The judgment of the trial court is affirmed on the basis of the findings of fact and the well-reasoned conclusions of law of the trial court. See 328 F.Supp. 33 (M.D.Georgia).

Affirmed.
